body:
On first blush this looks good. 

1.  prefNames are strings, so all good
2. pref values are null|int|bool|string, and I think this handles all those cases
3. this mirrors some aspects of the pref systems:  defaultness, isSet, exists.

I think that talking about 'defaultPrefBranch', and 'userPrefBranch' or that mess is too complex for user code to see anyway, but I could be wrong?

F+ unless I am missing things!
body_text:
On first blush this looks good.

prefNames are strings, so all good
pref values are null|int|bool|string, and I think this handles all those cases
this mirrors some aspects of the pref systems:  defaultness, isSet, exists.

I think that talking about 'defaultPrefBranch', and 'userPrefBranch' or that mess is too complex for user code to see anyway, but I could be wrong?
F+ unless I am missing things!
body_html:
On first blush this looks good.

  1. prefNames are strings, so all good
  2. pref values are null|int|bool|string, and I think this handles all those cases
  3. this mirrors some aspects of the pref systems: defaultness, isSet, exists.

I think that talking about 'defaultPrefBranch', and 'userPrefBranch' or that mess is too complex for user code to see anyway, but I could be wrong?

F+ unless I am missing things!
